alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:53AM EDT until April 21 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River from Elliston to Hazleton. .Rainfall amounts of one to two inches across much of central Indiana yesterday will lead to lowland and minor flooding along the East Fork White, lower White, and Wabash Rivers. River flooding could last into next week in lower parts of the basins. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Thursday /9:30 AM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 17.6 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
